intro: Jacquemontia gabrielii, commonly known as Gabriel's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing habit and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. The plant produces vibrant pink to purple blooms that typically open in the morning and close by midday. Its leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, hairy texture, while its stems are hairy and twining. Jacquemontia gabrielii is often found in moist, open habitats such as woodlands and prairies.
